alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 2:00PM MDT until May 19 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, including the southern Douglas County and western Elbert County. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 159 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Castle Rock, Elbert, Elizabeth, Kiowa, Larkspur, Greenland, Ponderosa Park, Perry Park, Devil`s Head, Westcreek, Castlewood Canyon and Fondis.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
